comments:
I've downloaded Eclipse 3.1, yet need to develop for 3.0.2 for our RCP app.
I Set the target platform to an SDK install of 3.0.2, imported external-plugins,
those required by my projects.

This compiles everything.

But when I go to run the application, eclipse is unable to launch and tells me
to look at the log. Its contents are:

!SESSION Thu Jul 07 16:28:38 EDT 2005 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jul 07, 2005 16:28:38.750
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.net.MalformedURLException: unknown protocol: c
    at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:544)
    at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:434)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.addDevEntries(Main.java:371)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getDevPath(Main.java:284)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:406)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:174)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:704)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:688)



I had tried on another machine some time ago, where eclipse was on the d drive,
and it said "unknown protocol: d". Obviously, somewhere its dealing with a
filesystem string on my windows machine, and not a url (file:/// ??). Does
anyone have a solution?

I was able to trace by breaking on the URL calls:

 I see that valid URLs look like

arg1=
"file:C:/31Workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/New_configuration/dev.properties"

 but that the one that messes up ...

arg1= "C:/eclipse-sdk-302/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.1/osgi.jar"

 How come it got there? Why does it not have file: ?

I'm sad I haven't heard from anyone.. but I fell upon this workaround, by chance.

I checked out, from dev.eclipse.org, the 3.1 version plugin "org.eclipse.platform".

I didnt change anything else, I just checked it out.

Now my launcher works...

To be precise, once it was checked out, I was able to run my rcp app.
 I then realized it picked up org.eclipse.platform 3.1. so I went back to the
plug-ins tab, unchecked org.eclipse.platform (3.1) from the top half of the
list, checked from external plug-ins the org.eclipse.platform (3.0.2) entry, and
it all works now.

Please see bug 78078 comment 17.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 78078 ***
